          EPOS, EPOS Recommends

          18 Best Vegetarian Restaurants in Singapore

          Posted on June 29, 2022November 4, 2022 by Adrija Chakravarti

          Singapore is definitely a hotspot for food. This little red dot is full of foodies craving their next meal, desire very apparent or hidden deep, deep down. And while it’s been a steep slope to get some vegetarian and vegan options here, the global popularity of healthy eating and sustainability have indeed seen the rise of vegetarian restaurants in Singapore.

          Also, vegetarian food can be so much more than just raw vegetables and rabbit food. Whether you’ve got dietary restrictions or just prefer to eat green, there are plenty of options packed with flavours and nutrients for you! So to help you out with your quest, we’ve put together this long list of amazing vegetarian restaurants in Singapore that’ll satiate your hunger with delish dishes.

          Contents hide
          Fantastic vegetarian restaurants in Singapore
          1. Whole Earth
          2. LingZhi Vegetarian Restaurant
          3. Cultivate Cafe
          4. Elemen
          4. Greendot
          6. Herbivore Japanese Vegetarian Restaurant
          7. Real Food
          8. The Boneless Kitchen
          9. Joie by Dozo
          10. Gokul Vegetarian Restaurant
          11. Lotus Vegetarian
          12. Ananda Bhavan
          13. Original Sin
          14. Project Açaí
          15. Sufood
          16. The Kind Bowl
          17. Warung Ijo
          18. Annalakshmi
          Conclusion
          Related Posts

          Fantastic vegetarian restaurants in Singapore

          1. Whole Earth

          Source: Whole Earth via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.wholeearth.com.sg/

          Address: 76 Peck Seah St, Singapore 079331

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11:30am-3pm & 5:30pm-10pm

          Whole Earth elevates the standards of plant-based foods with their unique take on vegetarian and vegan cooking. As the first authentic Peranakan-Thai vegetarian restaurant in Singapore, they’ve got a headstart on what makes authentic vegetarian food taste truly delicious. Not only that, they use quality ingredients and constantly explore global cuisines and ingredients to bring new and innovative tastes to their plant-based foods!

          2. LingZhi Vegetarian Restaurant

          Source: LingZhi Vegetarian Restaurant via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.lingzhivegetarian.com/en/home

          Address: 541 Orchard Road, Singapore 238881

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11am-3pm & 6pm-10pm

          LingZhi Vegetarian Restaurant prides itself on innovative twists on classic Chinese dishes. Their goal? To create fresh, tasty vegetarian food without using mock meats, additives and artificial colouring. Here, you’ll find meticulously prepared dishes with fresh, natural ingredients and high standards of cooking to preserve the original flavours. Look forward to hearty plates full of mushrooms, and pretty, Instagram-worthy plating that’ll make your mouth water with delight!

          3. Cultivate Cafe

          Source: Cultivate Cafe via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://cultivatecafe.sg/

          Address: 2 Cook Street, Singapore 078857

          Operating Hours: Daily, 7am-9pm

          This cozy cafe shifts the focus onto flavorful, plant-based vegan food made from the finest ingredients. Besides, they maintain sustainability through only sourcing their organic ingredients from small and family farms across the country and globe. Set in a library, you’ll find yourself immersed in fresh juices, colourful vegetables, gluten-free breads, and more. What’s more, expect a packed menu full of plant-based, GMO-free, gluten-free and purely vegan food with an emphasis on the seasonality of ingredients. This vegetarian restaurant in Singapore definitely checks all of the boxes!

          4. Elemen

          Source: Elemen via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.elemengroup.com.sg/

          Address: Locations

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11:30am-3pm & 5:30pm-9pm

          Swing by Elemen for its modern interpretation of meatless cuisine. You’ll find Western, Japanese and Chinese inspired menu items (though they differ depending on the outlet!) devoid of any mock meat. Explore quinoa salads, fruit rojak, mala pasta, wild mushroom and truffle pizzas and more! Mushroom lovers will adore this palace as so many of their dishes include all sorts of mushrooms! In the end, Elemen offers flavourful and affordable dining options if you’re looking for a yummy vegetarian restaurant in Singapore.

          4. Greendot

          Source: Greendot via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.greendot.sg/

          Address: Locations

          Operating Hours: Locations

          Greendot has been making healthy meat-free food since 2011, making it convenient and affordable for anyone to enjoy. They believe that eating green starts with fresh, quality ingredients, and tasty, nutritional menu options that you will love! Mushroom lovers will enjoy their signature Lion Mane Mushroom Rendang. Also, make sure to try out their popular Laksa Noodles and QQ Tofu (and, of course, their colourful selection of vegan cakes for dessert)!

          6. Herbivore Japanese Vegetarian Restaurant

          Source: Herbivore Japanese Vegetarian Restaurant via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.herbivore.sg/

          Address: 190 Middle Road, Singapore 188979

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11:30am-3pm & 5pm-9pm

          Find pure vegetarian dishes that are both attractive and mouth-wateringly delicious right at one of the first  Japanese vegetarian restaurants in Singapore! Herbivore uses the finest and freshest organic ingredients to produce a well-designed menu of Japanese and Western favourites. Sashimi, ramen, tempura udon soup and more; you’ll find an array of authentic dishes that definitely won’t miss! In fact, Herbivore’s passion is not only to serve vegetarians, but to encourage non-vegetarians to enjoy meatless cuisines as well.

          7. Real Food

          Source: Real Food via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.realfoodgrocer.com/

          Address: Locations

          Operating Hours: Daily, 10am-10pm

          For health-conscious vegetarians, Real food may be your new hangout! They’re not just about serving vegetarian food with quality ingredients, but also make sure to give allergen-free options for everyone to enjoy. With an uber-specific menu, you’ll know exactly what goes in every dish – ingredients, allergens, macronutrients and calories. Savour some delish delights like portobello burgers, classic margherita pizzas, baked brown rice, stuffed veggie salads and a range of all-day breakfast items! Enjoy a lovely breakfast, lunch, snack or dinner with friends or family in this zen vegetarian restaurant.

          8. The Boneless Kitchen

          Source: The Boneless Kitchen via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://thebonelesskitchen.com/

          Address: 1 Irving Place, Singapore 369546

          Operating Hours: Tue-Sun, 12pm-9pm

          When you think of Korean food, barbecued meat and fried chicken is probably what comes to mind. But there’s more to Korean cuisine and that’s what The Boneless Kitchen is all about: introducing good Korean food to vegetarians. With fresh ingredients imported straight from Korea, quality food made from scratch, and a little bit of ingenuity, you can dine on plant-based vegetarian food that still retains yummy, authentic Korean flavours. Don’t miss out on delectable dishes like handmade Kimchi Mandy, tempting Kimbap and flavourful Soondubu Jjigae at The Boneless Kitchen!

          9. Joie by Dozo

          Source: Joie via website – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.joierestaurant.com.sg/

          Address: 181 Orchard Road, Singapore 238896

          Operating Hours: Daily, 12pm-3pm & 6pm-10pm

          This is not your typical vegetarian restaurant. Joie (pronounced ‘joy’) explores what can be done with some fresh fruits, veggies and herbs if one has just a little bit of creativity and innovation. They redefine fine dining. With unique presentations and elaborate, contemporary dishes, your taste buds will go on an adventure like never before. Choose a six-course lunch or seven-course dinner along with a serene, chic atmosphere for an amazing dining experience!

          10. Gokul Vegetarian Restaurant

          Source: Gokul Vegetarian Restaurant via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Website: https://gokulvegetarianrestaurant.com/

          Address: 19 Upper Dickson, Road Singapore 207478

          Operating Hours: Sun-Thu, 10:30am-9:30pm | Fri-Sat, 10:30am-10pm

          Given that about a third of India’s population is vegetarian, it’s a no brainer that an Indian restaurant would appear on this list. In this case, Gokul Vegetarian Restaurant plates up 100% vegetarian food from multiple cuisines from North and South Indian, Malay and Chinese, and all free from onions, garlic, eggs, or MSG! Even so, bland and boring vegetarian food? Out the window, not even a thought in Gokul Vegetarian Restaurant’s mind!

          11. Lotus Vegetarian

          Source: Lotus Vegetarian via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Address: 103 Irrawaddy Rd, Singapore 329566

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11:30am-9:30pm

          Are you ready for a menu of vegetarian Asian cuisines that’ll excite your senses? Lotus Vegetarian Restaurant mainly showcases an array of Chinese dishes, though is inspired by hundreds of Asian cuisines to bring you a menu full of decadent delights. All dishes are handcrafted and are constantly innovated upon for refreshing new dishes that are sure to please diners. House favourites include beancurd rolls, dumplings, mushrooms, fried rice, grilled “fish” in broth, and premium bento sets. Sit down in an elegant, oriental-inspired dining room that sets you in the mood to eat, and tuck into a meal worth savouring!

          12. Ananda Bhavan

          Source: Elements Envato – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Website: https://anandabhavan.com/

          Address: Locations

          Operating Hours: Daily, 8am-9pm

          As the oldest Indian vegetarian restaurant in Singapore, Ananda Bhavan celebrates an abundant menu of North Indian, South Indian and Indian Chinese cuisines. They use the latest technology and cooking techniques to prepare revolutionary cuisine that retains quality and nutritional value. It embodies the decades of history since its establishment as well as the contemporary values of today’s world. Try popular dishes like set meals, Naan, Prata, Dosa, Paneer Butter Masalas, Gobi Manchruians, Biryani (and Western dishes like burgers and pizzas)! And, of course, you can’t visit an Indian restaurant without sampling the chaats or gloriously delicious Indian sweets!

          13. Original Sin

          Source: Original Sin via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.originalsin.com.sg/

          Address: 43 Jln Merah Saga, Singapore 278115

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11:45am-4pm & 5pm-8:30pm

          Named after the famous fresco painted in the Sistine Chapel, Original Sin combines classic Mediterranean cuisine with innovative creativity and passion. Having been creating delicious and exciting vegetarian dishes since 1997, you know they know their stuff! At Original Sin, you can dine alfresco or in a candlelit atmosphere surrounded by warmth and nature. Experience light, filling and guilt-free food made with fresh ingredients to enhance the natural aromas, right here at this vegetarian restaurant in Singapore!

          14. Project Açaí

          Source: Project Açaí via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://project-acai.com/

          Address: Locations

          Operating Hours: Locations

          Anyone else craving açaí right now? As Singapore’s first cafe dedicated to this delicious superfood, you’ll be delighted to find freshly blended açaí bowls ready for you to savour! And, and, and! Project Açaí makes their own Açaí base in small batches daily to make sure they’re as fresh as can be and retain all of their superfood antioxidants and nutritional goodness.

          15. Sufood

          Source: Sufood via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://sufood.com.sg/

          Address: 252 North Bridge Road, Singapore 179103

          Operating Hours: Daily, 11:30am-3pm & 5:30pm-10pm

          Simple, nourishing, carefully prepared whole food. That’s what Sufood is all about! This stylish Taiwanese vegetarian restaurant in Singapore opened its doors to our little red dot in 2014, and has since offered excellent quality food! You can choose between 4, 6 and 8-course meals or opt to order ala-carte, with a range of delicious options. Browse yummy appetisers, salads, soups, and mains; there’s no shortage of mouth-watering dishes. Don’t miss out on their signature lion’s mane mushrooms, 5 grain rice with black truffle and mushroom, or cream or black truffle soup!

          16. The Kind Bowl

          Source: The Kind Bowl via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.thekindbowl.com/

          Address: Locations

          Operating Hours: Locations

          Hungering for good vegetarian Vietnamese food? Then, The Kind Bowl is the vegetarian restaurant in Singapore for you! Born to bring greater awareness of eating green’s health benefits, The Kind Bowl gives you an affordable yet ethical vegetarian Vietnamese menu. They value making kinder choices for everything: people, yourself and the planet! Made from 100% plant-based ingredients, you can be kind to the planet and yourself with bowls of pholicious food!

          17. Warung Ijo

          Source: Warung Ijo via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Instagram: Visit Here

          Address: 337 Beach Rd, Singapore 199565

          Operating Hours: Tue-Fri, 11am-3pm & 5pm-9pm | Sat-Sun, 11am-3:30pm & 4:30pm-9pm

          Tuck into fantastic Indonesian food made vegetarian at Warung Ijo, from favourites like mee goreng, nasi lemak rendang and petai fried rice! They’ve got everything you need to dig into a balanced meal, from mock meats to vegetables, rice, tofu and tempe, and delicious sides for an extra kick! Plus, it’s alliums-free and vegan-friendly so any vegans can also enjoy amazing Indonesian food right here!

          18. Annalakshmi

          Source: Annalakshmi via Facebook – Vegetarian Restaurant Singapore

          Facebook: Visit Here

          Website: https://www.annalakshmi.sg/

          Address: 20 Havelock Rd, Singapore 059765

          Operating Hours: Tue-Sun, 11:30am-3pm & 6pm-9pm

          Annalakshmi was created by volunteers sharing their ancestral recipes curated over generations. Their philosophy of “eat as you want, give as you feel” prospers through their delectable food and humble community service in both India and Singapore. From North Indian fluffy basmati rice and soft breads to South Indian sambars and hearty dosas, expect delicious, wholesome food for the soul at this vegetarian restaurant!

          Conclusion

          Am I the only one hungry after reading this? I hope not!

          Vegetarian cuisine is more than just unappetising salads and tofu. Each of these restaurants have a unique spin on what they think is healthy, sustainable and appealing. Explore a world beyond those with these vegetarian restaurants in Singapore!

          Looking for other delicious things to eat around Singapore? Take a look at some of our other articles for scrumptious Singapore food!

          • Written by Adrija Chakravarti
